results.title: Office Safety
results.brief_description: Looks at safety in the office and dispels the notion that offices are safe workplaces but can in fact be the exact opposite. The video covers safety awareness in the office - recognition, evaluation and control; the office environment - correct sitting posture, correct way to lift and carry objects; falls in the office and how to avoid them; office fires and what to do when there is one; storage of chemicals and what to do if there is faulty equipment.

results.title: Office practice: your attitude
results.brief_description: Your attitude is showing - in your grooming, dress and posture. It shows in the way you speak and listen, by the questions you ask, and the way you use your own initiative. Different office workers reveal that attitude is a matter of getting along with people - your supervisors and co-workers - and yourself.

results.title: Office killer
results.creator_credit: Cindy Sherman, Pamela Koffler, Christine Vachon and Artfear Productions
results.brief_description: Usually known for her extensive career in photography spanning over 20 years, Cindy Sherman directs her first feature film and brings to life the characters that she has depicted within her photography. Dorine (Kane) is the company doormat, seemingly obliging and mild mannered until one day she accidentally electrocutes a fellow worker, who happens to be her most obnoxious opponent. The unhinged Dorine continues her killing spree believing that all can be friends when dead. Her antics verge on discovery when the bitchy co-worker played by Molly Ringwald suspects that all is not okay. Following in the b-grade genre of film-making, Sherman delights with an excess of gory special effects. Cast also includes: Jeanne Tripplehorn.

results.title: Office etiquette
results.brief_description: Shows the progress of a girl typist in her first job; how she settles down to her new work, learns and makes a success of her new vocation by obeying the simple rules of good office behaviour. Illustrates the deficiencies of some office-workers from the employer’s viewpoint.

results.title: Off the rails: memorabilia of the Great Western Railway
results.creator_credit: Mike Slee, David G. Rose, Kathy Rose, Philip Goodhand-Tait and Span Pictures
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Story of steam”.
The history of a nation’s progress is the history of her sons’ achievements, their hopes and disappointments, their failures and successes. English history during the past one hundred years provides no finer example of this than the story of that great railway which linked London with the West Country. This documentary traces the history of the Great Western Railway (GWR) through archival footage and stills, and the Great Western Society which was set up around the early 60s by a group of schoolboys. Over the years the members of the Society have collected and restored all manner of memorabilia belonging to or used by the GWR to the point where eventually they established the Small Relics Museum at the Didcot Railway Centre in Oxfordshire. Many examples of these pieces are shown throughout the documentary along with a visit to one of the last GWR signal boxes still working. A must for all those lovers of railways and steam trains. Introduced and narrated by Mike Savage.

results.title: Off the beaten track
results.creator_credit: Syd Sharples, Youth Hostels Association and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: Would you like to sleep in a castle, pony-trek in Wales, or relax on the beaches of Northern Ireland? Would you like to climb the mountains or paddle your own canoe on Loch Lomond? By train, ship, cycle or shank’s pony, the countryside is yours and with the facilities provided by the Youth Hostels Associations your holiday can be expansive rather than expensive.
